page.title: 17N.Upottery:Our flowers
page.content: The old-fashioned meadow has disappeared with intensive management of the grassland,but there remain the flowers of the hedgerows,copses and little pockets of uncultivated land, and these are a great joy;especially in the spring and early summer, before the hedges are trimmed.That is the time for drifts of snowdrops,wood anemones,primroses,celandine,violets, coltsfoot,even wild daffodils,to appear;to be followed by banks of bluebells,campion,and Queen Anne's lace,with sometimes a clump of ramson or the spikes of purple orchis.Later still come the foxgloves,ferns, Herb Robert,yarrow,tansy,buttercup,wild strawberry,nipplewort,stitchwort,knap- weed,agrimony,meadowsweet,willowherb and many more.A search will find marsh marigolds,musk and Ragged Robin.
